title: mpi-ext.h does not exist for mpich
body_html:
🐛 Bug

mpi-ext.h does not exist in mpich, so I could not compile torch/lib/c10d/ProcessGroupMPI.cpp with mpich for CPU-based MPI support. Although I had CUDA during installation, I think the same would happen without CUDA considering the context of the code.

To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

  1. Try to install pytorch with MPICH 3.0.

....
Scanning dependencies of target c10d
[ 28%] Building CXX object CMakeFiles/c10d.dir/FileStore.cpp.o
[ 28%] Building CXX object CMakeFiles/c10d.dir/ProcessGroup.cpp.o
[ 28%] Building CXX object CMakeFiles/c10d.dir/CUDAUtils.cpp.o
[ 28%] Building CXX object CMakeFiles/c10d.dir/Utils.cpp.o
[ 28%] Building CXX object CMakeFiles/c10d.dir/Store.cpp.o
[ 28%] Building CXX object CMakeFiles/c10d.dir/TCPStore.cpp.o
[ 38%] Building CXX object CMakeFiles/c10d.dir/ProcessGroupMPI.cpp.o
[ 38%] Building CXX object CMakeFiles/c10d.dir/ProcessGroupGloo.cpp.o
/shared/pytorch/torch/lib/c10d/ProcessGroupMPI.cpp:5:52: fatal error: mpi-ext.h: No such file or directory
#include <mpi-ext.h> // Needed for CUDA-aware check
^
compilation terminated.
make[2]: *** [CMakeFiles/c10d.dir/ProcessGroupMPI.cpp.o] Error 1

Expected behavior

Environment

Please copy and paste the output from our
environment collection script
(or fill out the checklist below manually).

You can get the script and run it with:

wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/pytorch/pytorch/master/torch/utils/collect_env.py
# For security purposes, please check the contents of collect_env.py before running it.
python collect_env.py
  • PyTorch Version (e.g., 1.0): 0.4.1
  • OS (e.g., Linux): CentOS 7
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): source
  • Build command you used (if compiling from source):
git clone --recursive https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch
cd pytorch/
git checkout v0.4.1
git submodule update --init
python setup.py install
  • Python version: 3.7 (via miniconda3-4.5.11)
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: 9.0
  • GPU models and configuration: None
  • Any other relevant information: A c5.18xlarge instance of AWS EC2 created by CfnCluster

Additional context

Using CUDA without GPU might seem weird, but it was the default from the CfnCluster's AMI.
